item.title: Report X-2024030480
item.description:
Report X-2024030480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030480 SequenceEvent: Package was received from unload wet and leaking, upon closer inspection it was revealed that the caps were loose on the hazardous product, thus causing the leakage. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed package in drum in Hazmat Cage. 2. X-2024030481 SequenceEvent: Package came down the flex slide leaking, upon further investigation it was revealed that the cause of the leak was caused by the loose caps, causing the leakage. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in Hazmat drum in the Hazmat Cage

item.title: Report X-2024030293
item.description:
Report X-2024030293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 2.5gallon plastic bottles of convo clean forte one 2.5gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .50 gallons to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 2.5gallon plastic bottle of convo clean forte had a loose cap allowing .50gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

DescribePack: There is a dent on one side of the box, found one shattered bottle in the same area where the dent on the box was on the outside. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: The box and the contents were placed upright and into a bin.

item.title: Report X-2024030242
item.description:
Report X-2024030242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We were called to trailer#822984 in the unload upon it being opened, for a presumed leaking hazmat. When we arrived, we found the hazmat loaded into the trailer upside down and above waist height, it was spilling all over the packages below it and spilled into the belly of the pup as well. All trk #'s above are pkgs that were damaged by this spill, they will be held until I get the disposition back for this incident. Hazmat spill protocol was followed, and all items are stored in Haz cage, spill was cleaned up and ph9'd cleanup supplies are in cage with damaged hazmat as well. Hazmat itself was placed in a hazardous materials tote lined with a bag and is on the corrosive pallet in the Haz cage. DescribePack: The pkg being upside down when loaded more than likely ruined the seal on the bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cleaned up and followed Haz spill protocol.

item.title: Report X-2024030361
item.description:
Report X-2024030361

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED ON VANLINE BELT, WET. PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A HAZMAT BIN WITH A HAZMAT BAG LINER. PIG MAT WAS USED TO ABSORB ANY EXCESS MOISTURE ON THE BELTLINE, THEN NEUTRALIZER WAS USED ON THE BELTLINE THAT STILL LOOKED MOIST. UPON INSPECTION, PLASTIC CAP ON INNER GLASS JAR WAS FOUND TO BE CRACKED. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION, BLUE PLASTIC CAP ON GLASS CONTAINER CRACKED ABOUT HALF WAY AROUND THE TOP EDGE OF CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: AS SOON AS THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE WET, PACKAGE WAS REMOVED TO A HAZMAT BIN WITH A HAZMAT BAG LINER.

item.title: Report E-2024030303
item.description:
Report E-2024030303

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer forklift operator hit a drum that was already staged in the trailer with the forkblade of his forklift puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Drum was immediate laid on its side and spilled material was cleaned with absorbent material and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report X-2024030202
item.description:
Report X-2024030202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: PITTSTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inadequate tape on the bottom of package, loose cap caused internal leakage. Orientation arrows were not respected. Protective equipment was used when hazmat was discovered, hazmat was then placed into hazardous bin. DescribePack: Failure due to loose cap, inadequate tape on bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Protective equipment was used. Placed package with orientation arrows facing in the correct direction. Used absorbent mats to mitigate spill. Package was placed into hazmat bin for further assessment.

item.title: Report X-2024030209
item.description:
Report X-2024030209

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged Hazmat in damaged area in QA. Grabbed my PPE to inspect the damage. DescribePack: I did not see any visible damage to the container. Found the cap at the bottom of the bag that the damaged hazmat was placed into, instead of on the container. DurationRel: 16 and MitigateEffect: Kept the plastic drum upright

item.title: Report E-2024030237
item.description:
Report E-2024030237

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Husqvarna 2-stroke fuel and oil (UN1203) was released from 2 boxes containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans per box due to improper loading. The release impacted the cardboard packaging only. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 30 gallon DM containing Cardboard and (8) 1-gallon cans of the product were containerized and left onsite as waste for the terminal to manage.
